intro: Struthanthus virgatus, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Struthanthus virgatus is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
